creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Leo A. Hodroff
description: Beale Family crest decoration, underglaze blue, Fitzhugh border
text: This hot water plate is decorated with a border of the "Fitzhugh" type with a central crest of the Beale family. Thomas Beale probably ordered this service while he was Prussian Consul in Canton between 1798 and 1815. The "Fitzhugh" pattern is named for Thomas FitzHugh, a director of the English East India Company who had a service with this border made about 1780.
title: Hot water plate
